body:
**What happened**:

When an issue happens at the following check in the conformance test "validates resource limits of pods that are allowed to run":
```
framework.ExpectEqual(len(scheduledPods), expectedScheduled, printOnce(fmt.Sprintf("Scheduled Pods: %#v", scheduledPods)))
```

the debugging message ("Scheduled Pods: %#v") doesn't appear in the log at all like the following:
```
[sig-scheduling] SchedulerPredicates [Serial]
/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/scheduling/framework.go:23
  validates resource limits of pods that are allowed to run  [Conformance] [It]
  /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/framework/framework.go:699

  Expected
      <int>: 1
  to equal
      <int>: 2
````
and that makes debugging difficult actually.

**What you expected to happen**:

The debugging message should appear in the log if an issue happens.

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.15.1
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: OpenStack
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.15.0-55-generic
- Install tools: kubeadm
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

title: printOnce() makes debugging difficult in a conformance test
